SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<headline>
China search and rescue team arrives in Nepal
</headline>
<post id="p1" author="lscat123" datetime="2015-04-26T20:24:50">
The 62-strong China International Search and Rescue Team arrived in Nepal on Sunday to carry out humanitarian mission following a 7.9 magnitude quake struck the country.

Shankar Koirala, Nepal's joint secretary of the Office of the Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers, warmly welcomed the Chinese team at the Kathmandu airport, terming their arrival as a timely assistance.
http://www.china.org.cn/china/2015-04/26/content_35421728.htm
</post>
<post id="p2" author="abramicus" datetime="2015-04-26T21:12:52">
CHINA SHOULD GIVE "ALL OUT HELP" TO NEPAL AS A TRUSTWORTHY NEIGHBOR . . .

62 aid workers will not do for such a big neighbor as China - that will be remembered as a "token" help - which is barely enough to take care of the Chinese ex-pats affected by the earthquake in Nepal.
What a truly BIG country should do for his LITTLE BROTHER NEPAL are the following:

1. Airlift with large cargo planes, cranes, bulldozers, helicopters, etc. - to help in the removal of debris, rescue buried people, and provide access to areas cut off by landslides and blocked roads.
2. Airlift with large cargo planes - tents, blankets, medicines (including antibiotics, intravenous fluids, and surgical equpment), electric power generators and lots, lots of cables).
3. Ten planeloads per day for ten days.
</post>
<post id="p3" author="abramicus" datetime="2015-04-26T21:38:16">
Here Is the First Mega-Project for the AIIB Led by China - Show Your Greatness.

THE NEPAL EARTHQUAKE DISASTER MANAGEMENT PROVIDES CHINA WITH THE CHANCE TO DEVELOP NOT ONLY LONG-TERM INFRASTRUCTURE CONSTRUCTION CAPABILITIES, BUT ALSO RAPID RESPONSE INFRASTRUCTURAL CONSTRUCTION CAPABILITIES, WHICH ARE ALL IN LINE WITH ITS DESIRE TO ESTABLISH AND LEAD THE ASIAN INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT BANK (AIIB) AND SPEARHEAD THE PROVISION OF "GLOBAL PUBLIC GOODS".
What better place to demonstrate China's sincerity, goodwill and capability than with a friendly neighbor in dire straits?
How about the following:
1. Provide instant loans to Nepal to build airstrips, helipads, warehouses for construction equipment and materials, and lease heavy equipment.
2. Provide instant loans to build health facilities that can be constructed overnight in disaster zones.
3. Drill wells and purify water for public consumption immediately, to prevent spread of epidemics.
4. A completely organized project of disaster relief coordinated with Nepalese government.
5. All construction equipment for now are to be owned by China, loaned to Nepal, with option for Nepal to pay for them at cost, lease them for future use, or receive as a gift from China.
</post>
<post id="p4" author="cestmoi" datetime="2015-04-27T06:38:25">
Well done, PRC China!
PRC China is a great nation indeed because great nations offer unconditional humanitarian aids in time of disaster and great sufferings.
</post>
